title: Iran attacks US military bases across Middle East in operation 'Truthful Promise 4'
content: The Revolutionary Guard said in a statement that in the first phase of the operation, named “Truthful Promise 4,” Iran’s military struck the command of the US 5th Fleet in Bahrain, as well as US bases in Qatar and the United Arab Emirates and military targets in Israel. However, the extent of the damage at the headquarters of the United States Fifth Fleet was not immediately clear. The base lies just southeast of central Manama, capital of the island nation of Bahrain.

title: Another wave of blasts heard in Doha as Iran tensions escalate — top developments
content: A massive cloud of smoke rose over Tehran following a daylight "preventive attack" by the United States and Israel, targeting military sites near Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's offices. Loud blasts were heard as the US confirmed its participation in the strikes, hours after President Trump expressed dissatisfaction with nuclear talks and hinted at a "big decision".

title: Why US-Israel has attacked Iran now - explained in 5 points
content: The United States and Israel have launched coordinated strikes on Iran. This marks a significant escalation in their long-standing confrontation with Tehran. The offensive has pushed the region closer to a full-scale war. Air and sea attacks were reported near Tehran and across Iran. Retaliatory missile launches rippled through Israel and the Gulf.

title: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy has a five-word reply for Jack Dorsey firing half of its staff
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy says he hasn't "really digested" Jack Dorsey's decision to lay off 4,000 employees — nearly half of Block's workforce — citing AI-driven efficiency gains. Jassy acknowledges that many jobs humans have done for decades won't need as many people going forward, but struck an optimistic note, saying new roles will emerge as they have with every past technology shift. He called it a "transition" period.

title: US-Israel strike Iran: Tehran says ‘time to defend homeland’, hits back with missiles – key points
content: United States and Israel on Saturday launched coordinated strikes on Iran. Explosions were reported across the country. Iran has retaliated with a barrage of missiles and drones targeting Israel. US military bases and facilities in the region were also attacked. Airspace across parts of the region has been shut. This marks a serious escalation in Middle East tensions.

title: Israel & US strike Iran: Where is Ayatollah Ali Khamenei?
content: Multiple explosions rocked Tehran after Israel announced a pre-emptive military strike, aiming to reduce perceived threats. Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has reportedly been moved to a secure, undisclosed location amid the escalating crisis. The United States is believed to have supported the operation, intensifying regional tensions.

title: 'Operation Epic Fury': How US, Israel encircled Iran before joint strikes
content: A new conflict has erupted in the Middle East. Israel and the United States have launched a joint operation named 'Epic Fury' against Iran. Strikes have begun near the offices of Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. US President Donald Trump announced major combat operations. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu stated the goal is to remove an existential threat.

title: Trump 'bans' Anthropic, gives it same label that China’s Huawei has in US since year 2018
content: Anthropic is locked in a high-stakes standoff with the Trump administration after refusing to give the Pentagon unrestricted access to its Claude AI model. The company drew a line at mass surveillance and autonomous weapons. In response, Trump ordered a government-wide ban on Anthropic's technology, while Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth designated it a "supply chain risk"—a label typically reserved for foreign adversaries.

title: Storm in Pakistan cricket: Mohsin Naqvi unhappy, Salman Agha set to be removed as captain
content: Pakistan's T20 captain Salman Ali Agha is set to be removed following the World Cup, irrespective of the team's performance. PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi is reportedly unhappy with the campaign's trajectory. Senior players, including Babar Azam, may also see their T20 international careers conclude after the tournament.

title: 'They just wanted to practice evil': After attack, Trump says Iran can never have nuclear weapon
content: In a significant escalation, the US and Israel have launched "major combat operations" targeting Iran, aiming to neutralize "imminent threats." Strikes hit multiple locations nationwide, including near Supreme Leader Khamenei's office. This coordinated action, involving US forces, underscores rising regional tensions and Iran's nuclear program concerns.

title: Nvidia CEO to worried investors: $700bn from Google, Meta, Amazon giving you nightmares is not enough
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang reassured investors that massive AI infrastructure spending by Big Tech is not a bubble but the start of a new computing era. He cited the 1,000-fold increase in computation needs and emerging applications like agentic and physical AI as drivers for sustained investment, dismissing fears of unsustainable spending.

title: How much prize money will J&K get for winning maiden Ranji title?
content: Jammu and Kashmir won their maiden Ranji Trophy title after drawing the final against Karnataka but securing a huge 291-run first-innings lead. They scored 584 in the first innings and extended their overall lead to 633 runs, with centuries from Qamran Iqbal and Sahil Lotra. As champions, J&K will receive Rs 5 crore in prize money.

title: Air India Express flight with 180 passengers stuck for 18 hours in Bengaluru
content: Passengers stranded at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport protested after an Air India Express flight to Kathmandu was repeatedly diverted due to bad weather, leaving them waiting for more than 18 hours. About 180 travellers, including a Karnataka tour group, faced inadequate arrangements during diversions to Varanasi and Lucknow. The airline has offered hotel stays and options to reschedule.

title: First Taliban, now Iran: Why it could be a double whammy for Pakistan
content: Pakistan faces a dangerous two-front strategic squeeze as coordinated US-Israel strikes on Iran coincide with its military escalation with Afghanistan. This "double whammy" threatens to destabilize its security and economy, compounded by existing tensions with India and resurgent domestic militancy.

title: Speed, social media and showboating: A teenage menace on wheels
content: Fatal crashes involving young motorists, including minors, are a disturbing trend across India. Incidents in Goa, Delhi, Pune, and other cities highlight issues of excessive speed, underage drivers, and weak supervision. These tragedies underscore the urgent need for stricter enforcement and parental accountability to prevent future loss of life.

title: Jammu and Kashmir script history, win maiden Ranji Trophy title
content: Jammu and Kashmir achieved a historic Ranji Trophy triumph, their first ever, after a draw against Karnataka in the final.  Dominating the match, J&K secured the title on first-innings lead, thanks to stellar performances from Shubham Pundir and Auqib Nabi. Centuries from Qamran Iqbal and Sahil Lotra sealed their maiden championship.

title: WB SIR final voter list: 1.18L names deleted in Bankura, Nadia sees around 2.71L deletions
content: West Bengal's Election Commission has started publishing updated electoral rolls after a Special Intensive Revision, with Bankura district seeing a net deletion of approximately 1.18 lakh voters. While hard copies are displayed, online access is still pending, leaving many voters anxious ahead of the upcoming assembly elections.

title: 22-year-old walks into UP police station with nail hammered into head; father, brother booked
content: A 22-year-old man, Sunil Singh, walked into a police station with a three-centimetre iron nail in his head, alleging his father and brother assaulted him during a property dispute. He claims this is a repeat incident, with his family asserting he struggles with alcohol addiction and was sent for de-addiction treatment. Police have registered an FIR and are investigating.

title: West Bengal SIR final voter list to be released today: Here is what to do if name missing
content: Bengal's final voter list, releasing Saturday, will retain 7.08 crore names after a four-month revision. Approximately 66 lakh entries will be marked 'deleted' or 'under adjudication'. Voters can check their status online or at local election offices to confirm eligibility for the upcoming Assembly elections.

title: India vs West Indies Super 8s: What happens if the match gets washed out?
content: India faces West Indies in a crucial T20 World Cup 2026 virtual quarterfinal at Eden Gardens. A win secures a semifinal spot against England, while a loss ends India's campaign. With a concerning net run rate, India must win, as a washout would see them eliminated due to West Indies' superior NRR.

title: ‘Hungry, tired, incapacitated’: Allahabad high court judge hears 30 cases in 1 day
content: An Allahabad High Court judge reserved a verdict after hearing 30 cases until 7 pm, citing hunger, fatigue, and physical incapacity to dictate the judgment. The judge had a packed schedule with 235 cases listed, but only managed to hear 29 before a Supreme Court-remanded matter extended proceedings significantly.

title: In the 2.5-billion-year-old Aravallis, I found time etched into stone
content: A traveler accustomed to the lush, cloud-kissed hills of Northeast India found a surprising new perspective in Rajasthan's Aravalli range.  The ancient, dry, and rolling landscape of the Aravallis, viewed from the Pushkar ropeway, offered a different kind of beauty, highlighting India's vast geographical diversity.

title: Indian-origin woman in England loses all four limbs after dog lick
content: A Birmingham woman’s life was changed forever when a dog’s lick on a small cut led to a life-threatening sepsis infection. The 56-year-old endured multiple cardiac arrests and quadruple limb amputations.

title: Class 10 boy assaulted inside school van after board exam in Meerut; other students held at gunpoint
content: A 15-year-old student was brutally assaulted inside his school van by armed assailants on the Meerut-Hapur highway. The attackers, who held other students at gunpoint, allegedly attempted to kill the boy over a six-month-old dispute. Police have registered an FIR and are searching for the accused.

title: US, Israel strikes in Tehran: India issues advisory, releases helpline number
content: India has issued an advisory for its citizens in Israel to exercise utmost caution and remain vigilant following Israeli and US attacks on Iran. Indian nationals are urged to follow safety guidelines, stay near shelters, and avoid non-essential travel. The embassy is monitoring the situation and providing updates.

title: ‘She came to know about my marriage’: Woman mixes intoxicant in milk, cuts man’s genitals in Delhi
content: A 22-year-old man was allegedly attacked by his female friend in Wazirabad, Delhi, on February 25. He claims she drugged him and then severed his genitals with a sharp weapon while he was asleep. The victim suspects the motive was related to his upcoming marriage.

title: Operation Lion’s Roar: How Israel and US planned the strikes on Iran
content: In a surprise daylight operation dubbed 'Lion's Roar,' the US and Israel launched coordinated strikes near Iran's Supreme Leader's offices, signaling a potential end to diplomatic efforts on Tehran's nuclear program. President Trump vowed to dismantle Iran's missile industry and navy, emphasizing the elimination of imminent threats.

title: 'The Kerala Story 2' box office Day 1: Film rakes in Rs 3.5 crore despite delayed release
content: Despite a last-minute legal hurdle, 'The Kerala Story 2: Goes Beyond' opened on February 27, 2026, earning an estimated ₹3.5 crore on its opening day. Early box-office data indicate a subdued start in Kerala, with expectations of improvement as the week unfolds. The release had been initially stayed by the Kerala High Court before the stay was lifted. Read on to know more in detail.

title: 'Extra added responsibility': Sanju Samson sends emotional message to CSK fans
content: Sanju Samson expressed his delight at the warm reception in Chennai, now his IPL home ground with CSK. He feels a strong emotional connection with the passionate Chennai crowd, acknowledging the added responsibility to entertain them.  Samson recently provided quick momentum for India against Zimbabwe with a brisk 24-ball innings.

title: Afghan Taliban shoots down Pakistani jet in Jalalabad, capture pilot alive
content: Pakistan bombed major cities in Afghanistan, including capital Kabul on Friday, with Islamabad’s defence minister declaring the neighbours at “open war” following months of tit-for-tat clashes. Pakistan claimed to have killed more than 270 Taliban fighters and injured over 400 others in airstrikes while Afghanistan’s Taliban government spokesman Zabihullah Mujahid said its forces killed 55 Pakistani soldiers.

title: YouTuber Saleem Wastik stabbed in Ghaziabad, in critical condition
content: A Ghaziabad businessman, Saleem Wastik, was critically injured after being repeatedly stabbed in his office by two helmet-clad assailants. Wastik, known for questioning religious fundamentalism on social media, was attacked by men who arrived on a bike. Police are reviewing CCTV footage and questioning neighbours to apprehend the suspects.

title: Israel attacks Iran: Explosions heard in central Tehran, sirens in Tel Aviv
content: Israel initiated a "preventative attack" on Iran Saturday, with the defense minister declaring a nationwide emergency. Explosions were reported in Tehran as sirens wailed across Israel, prompting a "proactive alert" for potential missile launches.

title: PAK vs SL washout scenario: Who will reach T20 World Cup semifinals?
content: Pakistan face a crucial Super 8s match against Sri Lanka, with their qualification hopes significantly impacted by the weather. Following England's win over New Zealand, Pakistan's destiny is in their own hands, but a washout would favor New Zealand.  The team must secure a substantial victory to advance.

title: 'Road is not for Muslims': 'Hate' graffiti on Delhi-Dehradun expressway
content: Police in Saharanpur have registered an FIR against unidentified members of the Hindu Raksha Dal for allegedly defacing a sound barrier on the Delhi-Dehradun Expressway with a message targeting Muslims. An NHAI employee filed the complaint after local residents reported the graffiti. A video circulating online appears to show a group taking responsibility for the act.

title: Foreign woman traveller 'harassed' by group of men in Mumbai
content: A foreign woman traveler, Ines Faria, has alleged harassment in Mumbai, sharing a video detailing her experience. She reported being followed and repeatedly asked for photos by a group of men, despite her refusals. Faria emphasized the importance of consent and personal safety, stating this was her first negative encounter in India.

title: Will England drop Buttler for the semi-final? Brook issues defiant message
content: Jos Buttler's T20 World Cup 2026 campaign has been a struggle, with only 62 runs in seven innings and five consecutive single-digit scores. Despite this lean patch, captain Harry Brook has backed Buttler, calling him the finest white-ball player and expressing confidence in his ability to bounce back in upcoming matches.

title: ‘Served country for 20 years’: Shops shut during Dalit soldier’s funeral in Karnataka
content: A soldier's funeral in Bagalkot district faced alleged untouchability practices. Shops reportedly closed as Dalit relatives arrived. Officials intervened, holding peace meetings. Relatives reported shops refusing cash transactions from Dalits. Ex-servicemen paid their respects. Further peace meetings are scheduled.

title: Son performs CPR in moving loader, father dies after ambulance fails to reach in time
content: A 65-year-old man died from a suspected heart attack in Chhatarpur district after an ambulance allegedly failed to arrive on time. His son rushed him to the hospital in a loader vehicle, but he succumbed to his condition en route. Doctors declared him dead on arrival at the district hospital.

title: ‘Will kill you’: Murder convicts tell UP judge after sentencing, say they know where he lives
content: Two men, sentenced to life for a dowry-related murder in Bijnor, issued chilling threats to the judge and the victim's daughter in court.  The convicts vowed revenge, prompting immediate police action to secure the judge's residence and ensure his safety. The murder victim was killed over a dowry dispute involving his daughter.

title: Major boost to India’s healthcare: PM Modi rolls out nationwide HPV vaccination drive
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched the nationwide HPV Vaccination Programme in Ajmer, Rajasthan, targeting 14-year-old girls to prevent cervical cancer. The free, voluntary vaccination initiative aims to cover 1.15 crore girls annually, bolstering women's health and preventive healthcare efforts across India.

title: Congress blames PM Modi for Trump's support to Pak amid conflict with Afghanistan
content: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh has sharply criticized US President Donald Trump's praise for Pakistan's leadership amidst the Afghanistan conflict, calling it a diplomatic setback for India. Ramesh also highlighted concerns over India's trade and strategic diplomacy with the US, citing a one-sided trade deal and the US imposing duties on Indian solar modules. He argued that India's 'Vishwaguru' image has been exposed.

title: Kejriwal's journey from jail to bail to clean chit: Court says probe agencies not political tools
content: A Delhi court cautioned probe agencies against using investigations to influence political outcomes, stating corruption charges in the liquor policy case lacked sufficient evidence. The judge emphasized that election funding irregularities fall under the Election Commission's purview, not criminal law, unless a distinct criminal offense is proven. This ruling highlights concerns about agencies overstepping their bounds.

title: Jerry sees Cowboys spending more in free agency
content: Cowboys owner and general manager Jerry Jones acknowledged Friday that he has let the fans down with Dallas' championship drought and has promised change -- starting with the team's approach to free agency.

title: Jokic angrily confronts Dort for 'unnecessary' foul
content: Thunder guard Lu Dort was called for a flagrant foul 2 and ejected from Friday night's game after appearing to trip Nuggets star Nikola Jokic, who called the play "an unnecessary move."

title: Celtics roll behind historic performance from floor
content: The Celtics posted one of the best offensive performances in league history on Friday night against the Nets.

title: Michigan stops Illinois, wins outright Big Ten title
content: No. 3 Michigan defeated No. 10 Illinois 84-70 on Friday night and clinched the Big Ten regular-season title.

title: Miami (Ohio) rallies by WMU late, moves to 29-0
content: Trey Perry scored on a driving layup with a second remaining, and No. 21 Miami of Ohio rallied to beat Western Michigan 69-67 to extend its season-opening winning streak to 29 games.

title: Sources: New WNBPA proposal offers concessions
content: The Women's National Basketball Players Association submitted a new counterproposal to the WNBA on Friday evening with some concessions on revenue share and housing, a source told ESPN on Friday.

title: Prochazka, Ulberg to vie for title as Pereira vacates
content: The UFC announced a vacant light heavyweight title bout between Jiri Prochazka and Carlos Ulberg at UFC 327, meaning former champ Alex Pereira has vacated his belt.

title: Ex-pitcher Serafini gets life in prison for murder
content: Former MLB pitcher Daniel Serafini was sentenced Friday to life in prison after being convicted of first-degree murder of his father-in-law, attempted murder of his mother-in-law and first-degree burglary.

title: Preview: Who will book their tickets to WrestleMania 42?
content: Out of the WWE loop? Here's everything you need to know ahead of Saturday's Elimination Chamber in Chicago.

title: Best NFL combine workouts, draft risers: The top performances and prospects from Day 2
content: Day 2 saw speedy defensive backs and a couple of tight ends put on a show. Here are our experts on the combine's top workouts.

title: 'You're looking at a Ferrari': Introducing Konnor Griffin, MLB's next teenage superstar
content: The No. 1 prospect in baseball has a chance to join exclusive company on Opening Day -- if the Pirates are willing to let him.

title: Why the East race is full of high stakes: 'Not a lot of honeymoons going on'
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst survey the league to see who has the edge in the wide-open Eastern Conference.

title: One free agent each NFL team should sign: We found 32 perfect fits
content: Mike Evans to the Bills? Malik Willis to the Jets? Riq Woolen to the Jaguars? We found free agent fits for all 32 teams this offseason.

title: Trade tier rankings: Which big names could bring a Stanley Cup?
content: The playoff races have restarted, with many teams seeking to bolster their rosters for a deep run this spring.

title: Bracketology: UNC inching closer but still outside of top 16
content: The Tar Heels are in third place in the ACC and have won 11 of their past 12 games, but they remain a No. 5 seed.

title: Premier League Power Rankings: Chelsea up, Liverpool down in ratings of all 20 teams
content: ESPN's Premier League Power Rankings return to look at all 20 teams: Chelsea are up, Liverpool are down, and Crystal Palace are on fire.

title: WWE 'SmackDown' results: Logan Paul earns spot in Elimination Chamber match
content: New tag team champions were crowned and a new entrant was added to Elimination Chamber on "SmackDown."

title: NBA awards update: Why Cunningham, Wembanyama are the bets to make for MVP
content: Andre Snellings looks at the NBA awards races and explains which ones to bet on, and which to avoid entirely.

title: Ten years into his UFC career, Brandon Moreno still thinks he can be a three-time champion
content: One more run at the flyweight title would cap an already historic career for Mexican MMA pioneer Brandon Moreno.

title: 'Attempting to mingle': Cameron Brink reveals how she met her fiancé via email
content: Brinks now-fiancé got in contact via unconventional means, eschewing social media direct messages and instead sending an email.

title: Stashing these injured players is a winning move
content: Eric Karabell serves up a list of currently injured players to keep on your radar for the last few rounds of your fantasy drafts.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Randle finishes in top 10, Nembhard in top 50
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Julius Randle, LaMelo Ball and more.

title: Champions League round of 16 predictions: Real Madrid over Man City?
content: The path to the Champions League final is now mapped out, but who do we think makes it all the way to Budapest? Mark Ogden makes his picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City, Man United in race to sign Anderson
content: Manchester City and Manchester United are set for a battle to sign Nottingham Forest's Elliot Anderson this summer. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: IndyCar 2026: Power's reclamation, Schumacher's rehabilitation, Palou's quest for history
content: Will Power is in new surroundings, Mick Schumacher is stateside, and Álex Palou is chasing history. Here's what to watch in IndyCar in 2026.

title: Iran Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei Targeted In Strikes: Israel
content: Iran's supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was the target of Saturday'sjoint Israeli-US strikes on Tehran, Israel's public broadcaster reported.

title: Explosions In Abu Dhabi, Dubai, Doha, Riyadh After US, Israel Strike Iran
content: Explosions were heard in the UAE's Abu Dhabi and Dubai, Qatar's Doha, and Saudi Arabia's Riyadh hours after Israel and the US conducted joint attacks on Iran, plunging the Middle East into a new conflict.

title: Iran Launches "Barrage Of Missiles" After Israel-US Attack, Explosions In UAE, Qatar, Saudi
content: Iran-Israel Tensions: The explosion came as tensions ran high between Iran and the United States over Tehran's nuclear program.

title: "No One Wanted To Negotiate": World Reacts To Israeli, US Attacks On Iran
content: Israel and the United States launched strikes on Iran on Saturday, plunging the Middle East into a renewed military confrontation as President Donald Trump vowed to destroy Tehran's missile arsenal and prevent it from developing a nuclear weapon.

title: "Peace President" On Warpath Again: How Trump Has Justified Attacking Iran
content: Iran Israel Live Updates: Less than a year ago, Trump had claimed 'Operation Midnight Hammer' had "obliterated" Iran's nuclear facilities.

title: Trump Showed "True Colours": Russia On Joint US-Israel Strikes On Iran
content: Russia delivered one of the earliest reactions to the joint United States and Israeli strikes on Iran, with former president Dmitry Medvedev accusing Washington of abandoning diplomacy and exposing its real intentions.

title: Missile Attack On US Navy Base In Bahrain As Chaos Grips Middle East
content: The United States' base in Bahrain has witnessed a missile attack as the Middle East plunges into a security nightmare after the US and Israel launched attacks on Iran.

title: US-Israel Attacks Iran LIVE Updates: Iran Vows "Decisive Response" After Israel-US Strikes
content: US-Israel Attacks Iran LIVE Updates: Israel launched a daylight attack Saturday on Iran's capital, with a cloud of smoke rising from the city's downtown. The apparent strike happened near the offices of Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.

title: US, Israel Launch 'Pre-Emptive' Air Strikes On Iran: What We Know So Far
content: Massive explosions were heard in the Iran's capital in the morning, however, no update on any casualty has been issued so far.

title: Raze, Obliterate, Annihilate: Trump's Blueprint For Iran Military Machine
content: US President Donald Trump said that the US has begun "major combat operations in Iran" after Israel launched strikes and said that the objective of the attack is to "defend American people".

title: Israel's Alert App Shows Country In 'Red' As Iran Launches Ballistic Missiles
content: The official Home Front Command app is Israel's primary tool for real-time life-saving alerts and emergency guidelines. Currently the app shows all of Israel in red, meaning ballistic missile launches have been detected from Iran.

title: US-Iran Conflict: What Are The Main US Military Bases In The Middle East?
content: Israel and the United States launched an attack on Iran on Saturday, plunging the Middle East into a renewed military confrontation.

title: "Op To Remove Existential Threat By Terror Regime": Netanyahu On Iran Strikes
content: The United States and Israel have launched coordinated military strikes against targets in Iran, with explosions rocking the capital Tehran and other cities on Saturday.

title: "We're With You": Mossad To Iranians As US-Israel Rain Fire On Tehran
content: In a rare public message, the Mossad hailed Israel's military operation against Iran, saying it will "bring back the glory days". The message came after Israel and the US launched strikes on Iran on Saturday morning after several days of planning.

title: Joe Biden Confronted By Passenger Over Gaza Deaths In Flight, His Reply
content: Former US President Joe Biden offered a brief three-word response when a passenger confronted him about children being killed by Israel in Gaza.

title: "Hold Polls Now, If BJP Wins 10 Seats, I Will Quit Politics": Arvind Kejriwal
content: The court, while granting the relief to Kejriwal, his deputy Manish Sisodia and 21 others in the case, was unsparing in its criticism of the CBI saying its charge sheet "suffers from internal contradictions, striking at the root of conspiracy theory"

title: Exiled Prince Tells Iranians "Final Victory Is Near" As Strikes Hit Tehran
content: Amid the US-Israeli joint strikes in Iran, Exiled Iranian Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi has issued a message urging citizens to remain calm but prepare for renewed protests, calling the current situation in Iran a decisive turning point.

title: Mount Abu To Be Renamed 'Abu Raj', Jahazpur And Kama To Also Get New Names
content: Chief Minister Bhajanlal Sharma on Friday announced in the Rajasthan Assembly that the state's renowned hill station, Mount Abu, will be renamed to "Abu Raj".

title: Airspace closure disrupts Kochi–West Asia flights after strikes on Iran
content: Following the closure of airspace over Iran, Iraq, Kuwait, Bahrain, and Qatar, the Cochin International Airport has issued a travel advisory warning passengers of potential changes to departure times or outright cancellations

title: Rajya Sabha race heats up in Odisha as Congress extends support to BJD candidate
content: Numerically, the BJD and Congress can send the fourth candidate with combined numbers it has in the Assembly and that move would block the ruling party’s apparent attempt to secure the seat in its favour

title: Row over Assembly poll candidate: RSP Eravipuram mandalam secretary resigns in protest
content: The conflict centres on the difference of opinion in the party over the selection of candidate for the seat; while a section of the RSP demanded the nomination of Karthik Premachandran, son of Kollam MP N.K. Premachandran, the party announced Vishnu Mohan as its candidate

title: Rahul seeks more funding of ECHS, tax exemption on disability pensions
content: He wrote about the newly introduced income tax on disability pensions, saying it should not be treated as income, and said it is "insulting" to tax something that should be praised

title: Manipur Governor meets Home Minister Amit Shah
content: Security forces are conducting operations to seize illegal weapons and destroy poppy fields, while the government is trying to reduce friction between communities, says officials

title: Omar Abdullah announces ₹2 crore cash reward for J&K’s maiden Ranji Trophy win
content: Calling it a watershed moment for Jammu and Kashmir cricket, the Jammu and Kashmir CM said, the landmark win has filled the entire region with pride and inspiration

title: Ten workers feared dead in a blast in firecracker unit in Kakinada district
content: 15 more workers are believed to be trapped in the flames; The blast occurred in one of the four units that were set up in a row, said police

title: Temple in Kasaragod hosts community iftar
content: The Sree Poobanam Kuzhi Temple at Panayal near Bekal organised the gathering, which was attended by around 200 people

title: Krishnagiri child sexual assault and murder: TVK demands fast-track trial
content: In a statement, the party expressed shock and anguish over the incident and alleged that the accused had been serving as a union-level organiser in the youth wing of the ruling DMK

title: West Bengal SIR 2026: How to check your name in final voter list
content: Figures from Bankura district in West Bengal show that about 1.18 lakh names have been removed since the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) process started in the state

title: India-U.S. trade deal will destroy Indian farmers: Rahul Gandhi
content: “PM Modi gave a guarantee to U.S. President Donald Trump that every year India will buy U.S. products worth ₹9 lakh crore,” says Rahul Gandhi

title: PM Modi to lay foundation for projects worth ₹1,571 crore in Puducherry on March 1
content: During the visit, the Prime Minister will announce the long-pending development of the 750-acre land at Sedarapet-Karasur villages in Puducherry into a Special Economic Zone, the first of its kind in the UT

title: Blue Jet Healthcare Unit: A Landmark in North Andhra’s Industrial Growth, says Nara Lokesh
content: The Minister for Education and IT emphasised that the government prioritises the actual grounding of industries rather than just making announcements

title: Telangana launches HPV vaccination programme at King Koti hospital in Hyderabad
content: The launch at the hospital was held around 11.30 a.m. and saw the participation of senior health officials, doctors, ASHA workers and parents

title: INC has become Muslim League-Maoist Cong, tries to defame country anywhere it can: PM
content: The Muslim League's hatred towards India was the reason for the Partition, and today, the Congress is acting in the same manner, says PM Modi

title: Demand to rename Andhra Pradesh as ‘Telugu Naadu’ resurfaces at third World Telugu Conference
content: Telugu language scholar Garikapati Narasimha Rao states that NTR fought to rename Andhra Pradesh as Telugu Nadu

title: J&K HC raps Srinagar District Magistrate, says accused’s detention under PSA ‘fundamentally flawed’
content: The court ordered the release of Muzaffar Farooq Mir, 36, a resident of Shahzadpora Dangerpora, B.K Pora, Budgam

title: ‘Exercise utmost caution’: India issues advisory to nationals in Israel and Iran
content: “In view of the developing situation, all Indian nationals in Iran are advised to exercise utmost caution, avoid unnecessary movements and remain indoors as far as possible,” the advisory said

title: Delhi-Tel Aviv flight returns following Israel airspace closure; Air India cancels all West Asia-bound flights
content: Another Air India flight from Chicago to Delhi was also observed taking a wider detour to avoid the region

title: APPSC Group-I recruitment: Supreme Court upholds HC order
content: The High Court directed that 326 candidates who qualified in the Group-I examination and were given focal posts, be shifted to non-focal ones within a week due to allegations of gross irregularities in the process of evaluation of answer sheets

title: Milk adulteration: Experts from Hyderabad KIMS, Apollo, AIG hospitals to rush Rajamahendravaram to treat 15 patients battling for life
content: 15 patients, including six women and three infants, are battling for life with acute renal failure after they consumed adulterated milk sold by the same vendor between February 16 and 19 in Rajamahendravaram city

title: Jharkhand civic polls: BJP-backed nominees win in Ranchi, Medininagar; JMM wins Giridih, Deoghar
content: Roshni Khalkho defeated her nearest Congress-backed rival, Rama Khalkho, by 14,363 votes. She secured 1,57,669 votes against Rama’s 1,43,306 in the contest, says an official

title: African honour for Shivamogga scientist for his role in saving maize crop from viral disease
content: Suresh L.M., who is an alumnus of the University of Agricultural Sciences, Bengaluru, was honoured recently in Nairobi for playing a key role in fighting the viral Maize Lethal Necrosis disease to save Africa’s maize crop through his decade-long work.

title: National social security board for gig workers soon, says Maharashtra Minister
content: "Gig and platform workers never had the status of workers and were considered business partners with delivery-based payments. For the first time, the social security code, which has been effective since November 2025, has defined the status of gig and platform workers," says Maharashtra Labour Minister

title: PM Modi launches nationwide HPV vaccination drive for 14-year-old girls
content: The campaign against cervical cancer was formally inaugurated at a programme held in Kayad, Ajmer, where several girls were administered the vaccine

title: NABARD projects ₹4.99 lakh crore credit potential for Karnataka in 2026-27
content: Surendra Babu, Chief General Manager (CGM) of NABARD’s Karnataka Regional Office, announced the figures while addressing the State Credit Seminar for 2026–27

title: ECI begins phased publication of post-SIR rolls in West Bengal; 1.18 lakh names deleted in Bankura
content: Hard copies of the updated rolls were put up in districts including Bankura and Cooch Behar, even as the lists were yet to be made available online on the designated EC portals and mobile application

title: Void created by Ajit Pawar's tragic death can never be filled: Supriya Sule
content: "It is still difficult to digest that our Ajitdada is no longer with us. The void created by his departure will never be filled,” says Supriya Sule

title: Kendriya Vidyalaya Sangathan to introduce Tamil as medium of instruction in select schools
content: KVS Regional Director says, a decision on implementing regional languages as medium of instruction in other KVs would be taken on the basis of the evaluation of the pilot project

title: PMK leader Anbumani slams DMK govt. over sexual assault and murder of toddler in Krishnagiri
content: PMK leader Anbumani Ramadoss launched a scathing attack against the ruling DMK, criticising the latter for rising crime and lawlessness

title: Hospital performs rare robotic surgery on eight-year-old boy in Vellore
content: The surgery, which was performed by the Christian Medical College (CMC), Vellore, marks a revolutionary advancement in minimally invasive airway reconstruction for children

title: Assam CM, Japan Foreign Affairs Minister discuss issues of mutual interest
content: "I am deeply grateful to H.E. Iwao Horii, Hon’ble State Minister for Foreign Affairs of Japan, for his visit to Assam," says Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: Andhra Pradesh gives strategic push to tapping potential of rare earths and beach sand minerals
content: Andhra’s move comes against Chinese domination over more than half of global titanium mineral production and controls over 90% of rare earth processing capacity

title: II PUC annual exam-1 begins in 1,217 examination centres across Karnataka
content: All examination centres were crowded, with parents dropping their children and students busy with last-minute preparations

title: Nine cheetahs from Botswana arrive at Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park
content: The third batch of cheetahs from Africa arrived on IAF aircraft as part of a four-year population revival plan, the official said

title: Man damages Andhra Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan’s convoy cars in Mangalagiri, taken into custody
content: The accused, identified as Narada Neeladri (35) from Kaviti mandal in Srikakulam district, had earlier worked in Chennai and had recently shifted to Vijayawada

title: Muted opening for The Kerala Story 2 despite court clearance
content: Though a Division Bench of the Kerala High Court stayed a single judge’s order halting the release on February 27, the film could initially be screened only in a handful of theatres with limited evening shows

title: Court accepts closure report in Maharashtra State Co-operative Bank case involving Ajit Pawar
content: The court's acceptance of the report came nearly a month after Pawar, then Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra, died in a plane crash in Baramati

title: Palayam Imam’s call to open mosques, homes to Pongala devotees goes viral
content: The Imam urged people of Muslim faith to become exemplary hosts to women and children reaching the State capital for the renowned Attukal Pongala festival in a few days from now

title: Maharashtra to vaccinate 9.84 lakh girls aged 14 as part of nationwide HPV vaccination campaign
content: Registration of all beneficiaries for HPV vaccination and distribution of certificates will be done completely digitally through the Central Government’s ‘U-WIN’ portal

title: Passengers protest at Bengaluru airport, as their flight ‘failed to land in Nepal for second day’
content: Protesters claimed they were confined inside the aircraft for more than 30 hours in total and accused the airline of poor coordination and communication

title: U.S. has got measure of 'self-declared Vishwaguru': Congress' dig at PM after Trump's Pak praise
content: "President Trump's full-throated and categorical support for Pakistan in its war with Afghanistan is another setback for Indian 'huglomacy'," says Jairam Ramesh

title: Justice Unplugged 2026 LIVE: 'Putting the constitution ahead of everything else is easier said than done': Justice Muralidhar
content: "Don’t say that Article 21 protects liberty and freedom, then deny bail to Sharjeel Imam," says Gopal Sankaranarayanan

title: AI Summit Protest: Delhi court grants bail to IYC president Chib
content: On February 24, the court allowed four days of custody to the police to question Mr. Chib over his role in the AI Summit protest held at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi

title: Four PREPAK (PRO) militants arrested in Manipur
content: Meanwhile, security forces, during an operation at Thinghijang village in Churachandpur district, seized an AK-47 rifle with a magazine, three single-barrel rifles, one bolt-action rifle and one bolt-action sniper rifle with a scope

title: J&K police secure non-bailable warrants against 4 Hizbul ‘commanders’, including chief Salahuddin
content: Officials said Salahuddin is the chief of the so-called United Jihad Council (UJC) and the proscribed terrorist organization Hizbul Mujahideen

title: Watch: Shashi Tharoor: What Kerala can learn from the rest of the world
content: Kerala has historically served as a bridge between the east and the west. It is time we ceased being merely a bridge — and started being the destination. A destination where the best of the world is adapted, improved, and offered back to humanity with a distinctly Malayali touch.

title: The Inverse Law of AI: How capital rises as responsibility falls
content: The recent proceedings in India confirm a quiet but distinct transition: the era of wondering if we should build certain things has been definitively replaced by the race to see how fast we can fund them

title: India and EU to give each other Most Favoured Nation status for 5 years, draft trade deal shows
content: The economic deal between India and EU opens up avenues for India and the EU to stabilise the international order

title: ‘Hidden camera’ found in bathroom of TISS-Guwahati girls’ hostel, probe underway
content: The TISS-Guwahati, in a statement, had said that the recent incident was a “serious privacy violation, and is entirely unacceptable and condemnable”

title: In Friday sermon, Mirwaiz expresses concern over ‘worrying’ situation in Palestine, Iran, Afghanistan
content: He expressed concern over what he described as “breakdown of international law and the moral conscience of the international community” in Palestine.

title: Congress chose appeasement over nation by truncating Vande Mataram, says Haryana CM Saini
content: He was speaking during a debate on the motion of thanks to the Governor’s address in the ongoing budget session of the State Assembly.

title: Surrendered Maoists attend Chhattisgarh Assembly proceedings
content: The group, which included 54 women, spent several hours in the Assembly building where they watched the proceedings and met Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai, Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Sharma and other senior Ministers who hailed the Maoists for their decision to return to the mainstream.

title: Kejriwal’s release exposed high handedness of investigative agencies: Mehbooba Mufti
content: The Awami Ittehad Party (AIP) welcomed the decision of a Delhi court. “The verdict reaffirms faith in the judiciary and the principle that truth ultimately prevails,” said AIP spokesperson Inam Un Nabi.

title: BJP-AGP poll deal likely by March 10: Assam CM Himanta
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma said the parties would go for a friendly contest in seats where they have disputes

title: Odisha police’s final push to bring CPI (Maoist) insurgency to end
content: Security forces have launched operation to nab Sukru, a State Committee Member, who is leading a small group of Left Wing Extremist in Odisha

title: Japan will connect Northeast India to the Bay of Bengal: Dy Foreign Minister Horii Iwao
content: Japan will support connectivity linking Northeast India to the Bay of Bengal and the Indian Ocean. Northeast India is located in a pivotal geopolitical position as a gateway to Southeast Asia, says Horii Iwao

title: District panchayat Budget proposes jobs for 5,000 women
content: Focus on comprehensive development of agricultural sector with an allocation of ₹18 crore; projects in housing and health sectors get ₹18 crore and ₹16 crore respectively

title: A double murder in ‘mini Russia’
content: The killing of two women in January, both named Elena, reopens old questions over foreigners’ deaths in Goa. Sujay Gupta visits Arambol, a fishing village in North Goa, known for playing host to performers, sunset-seeking international travellers, and beach front bars. Running in the background are the stories of victims of alleged murders, whose families from overseas are still fighting for justice

title: Tenth Chiefs’ Conclave bats for future preparedness, wisdom sharing
content: The two-day conclave serves as an institutional platform for professional interaction between the present Army leadership and former Chiefs, fostering continuity and the sharing of collective wisdom across generations

title: As J&K nears Ranji Trophy win, Omar heads to Karnataka to cheer for the home team; BJP and PDP extend support
content: Playing against Karnataka in the summit clash of the nation’s prestigious domestic cricket competition, J&K was in a commanding position on the penultimate day of the five-day contest, securing a 477-run lead at the KSCA Rajnagar Stadium in Hubbali

title: Amit Shah concludes his three-day visit to Bihar’s Seemanchal
content: Mr. Shah directed strict enforcement of a zero-tolerance policy against illegal constructions, particularly in forest and uninhabited areas, and ordered the immediate removal of encroachments identified on No Man’s Land.

title: SC/ST medical students pressured to pay for internship year
content: In several colleges, fourth-year students are being pressured to pay the fifth-year tuition fee, and are not being permitted to write their fourth-year examinations unless the fee is paid

title: Kochi Corporation Budget approved amid Opposition boycott
content: For the Budget to be viable, the Corporation must collect property tax worth ₹78 crore in a single month, which is an uphill task, says LDF

title: MCC would be strictly implemented in Tamil Nadu against poll inducements, says CEC Gyanesh Kumar
content: Out of 5.67 crore electors, only 216 appeals have been filed till day, points out CEC; ‘SIR in TN was a model for the country, great success,’ he says

title: Dust, bottlenecks and stench greet Srinivagilu Road commuters as white-topping works drag on
content: Adding to the misery, the Intermediate Ring Road, which runs parallel, is already congested at Sony Signal and the Ejipura Junction, making commuting in the area a Herculean task

title: Food safety officials inspect milk supply chain in SPSR Nellore district
content: After the milk adulteration incident in East Godavari district, officials intensify quality checks at dairies across the district and send samples of milk products to labs for testing

title: Women to move from drudgery to decision-making in agriculture: Union Agriculture Secretary
content: The senior bureaucrat inaugurated businessline’s fifth Agri and Commodity Summit in New Delhi where he spoke about how almost 50% of the rural workforce in the agricultural sector comprises women

title: CPI(M) is fighting both TMC and BJP in West Bengal: M.A. Baby
content: CPI(M) general secretary counters West Bengal Chief Minister’s remarks on a growing CPI(M)-BJP alliance, terming it “ironical”; accuses both BJP and TMC of fuelling communal polarisation

title: Tribal Affairs Ministry set to revamp forest rights cells, form ‘one-stop’ coordinating units
content: Govt. expands mandate of FRA cells to coordinate on all policies; Odisha shuts 50 FRA cells, Chhattisgarh officials say exploring the way forward

title: O. Panneerselvam: A man undone by his own decisions
content: When he joined the DMK in the presence of Chief Minister M.K.Stalin, Mr. Panneerselvam was accompanied by only one legislator, P. Ayyappan. After his expulsion from the AIADMK in July 2022, Mr Panneerselvam had the support of two prominent leaders - R. Vaithilingam and P.H. Manoj Pandian. They joined the DMK recently.

title: Israel-US strike Iran: Air India's Tel Aviv flight makes U-turn midway
content: hundreds of commercial flights were either overflying or just about to enter the impacted airspaces from Iran to Israel . the airline asked the pilots to turn back & head to Mumbai . AI is now working to evacuate its crew from Tel Aviv .

title: Matt Holliday's Stillwater estate listed for $12 million
content: a Stillwater, Oklahoma, home that once belonged to an MLB champion and seven-time All-Star is on the market at $12 million . the home features sports-related amenities such as a professionally lit baseball field in the front yard, a putting green in the backyard, and a $2 million, two-level swimming pool . indoor batting cages, pickleball and basketball courts reside in a detached $150,000 guest home on the property .

title: Preview for the 2026 PLL, WLL Championship Series: Key players, schedule, predictions
content: the 2026 PLL and WLL Championship Series runs from Feb. 27 to March 8 . the event uses the Sixes format, which will be used when lacrosse returns to the Olympics in 2028 . it has key differences from outdoor "field" lacross and indoor "box" la crosse .

title: An Ivy League All-American? The next Theo Epstein? Why an ace chose Yale over the SEC
content: OHman was a freshman navigating his first collegiate baseball season . the 6-foot right-hander barely pitched in high school . he admits he considered leaving the Ivy League for a power 4 school, but who would blame him .

title: Power Rankings: Stakes are high for UCLA, two teams rejoin the list
content: the Bruins will be just the fourth program to finish with a perfect regular season in the Big Ten women's college basketball . the last to do it was Maryland in 2015, the season the Terps joined the big Ten and advanced to the final Four for the second year in a row .

title: Weekend predictions: Arsenal, Bayern title bids on the line?
content: arsenal host manchester city in the premier league on saturday . arsenal are back at the Emirates for another London derby and another huge game in their quest for a long-overdue title . aaron ramsey and samuel eto'o are all in the top five . click here for more arsenal news .

title: NHL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, over/under bet for each team
content: the 2026 Olympic ice hockey tournament is complete . all players have returned to their teams, some to the ice, others to injured reserve . a new 1-32 poll is based on the games through Wednesday . it's time to take the temperature with another set of Power Rankings .

title: How the top QB signings will fit in 2026
content: the top 2026 recruits at each position could fit at their new schools . the perfect harmony between skill and scheme can lead to production and wins on the field . this is the most high-profile prospect Houston has signed in the modern era .

title: The game that will define the 2026 season for every power-conference team
content: the season-defining game will be for all 68 power-conference teams in 2026 . peruse BC's schedule given last year's struggles, and it's tough to find many wins . the Eagles open on the road at Cincinnati, then play FCS Maine .

title: Preview, key stats to know for ABC Saturday: Penguins-Rangers, Bruins-Flyers
content: the 2026 Olympic men's hockey tournament is complete . the Pittsburgh Penguins face off against the new york Rangers . in the second game, the Boston Bruins take on the Philadelphia Flyers in the playoffs . they will have Rasmus Ristolainen, Dan Vladar and Travis Sanheim .

title: Wetzel: In search of NFL's fact-finding mission on Giants owner Tisch
content: it has been four weeks since the release of emails between sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein and new york Giants co-owner Steve Tisch . the league will look at all the facts to determine whether a full investigation was in order for potential violations of the league's personal conduct policy . "Absolutely we'll look at the context of those [emails] and try to understand that," Goodell said .

title: 25 surprising stars: Tyler Tanner, Ebuka Okorie, more breakouts
content: the 2025-26 men's college basketball season has been defined by the stars who have turned it into one of the most exciting for the sport in recent memory . the freshman class has an abundance of talent, and there are transfers who have transformed programs, with multiple from either category emerging as household names . we've identified 25 breakout stars to know -- players who have bounced back from injuries .

title: ✍️ NFLPA 2026 report cards for all 32 teams
content: ESPN obtained the results of the NFL Players Association's 2026 report cards . it grades franchises from A-plus to F-minus on everything from ownership to treatment of families . all players who were on a 2025 roster at the time of the survey were eligible to participate .

title: Does anyone beat Ohtani? Buster Olney ranks the top 10 designated hitters
content: coach Buster Olney ranked the best of the best at designated hitters . the goal of this exercise is to identify the best players for the 2026 season, not who might be best in five years or over their career . we rolled out a position per day over two weeks .
